  sgcool_label_text: This short jacket is known as a ‘magua’ ?? and was worn over a long robe (‘changshan’ or ‘changpao’) in the early 20th century in China and Hong Kong. This fur-lined jacket would have been used during the winter season. \r\n\r\nIt belonged to Mr Kaan Tat Choi
 who was a successful businessman in the bullion business. Mr Kaan expanded his business from Hong Kong to Malaya in the 1920s
 acquiring several rubber plantations along the east coast of Malaya. He also opened a bullion trading company called “Yee Shing” at 20 Canal Road in Singapore in the 1930s\r\n

metadata.title_text: Men’s maroon short jacket with fur lining
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a maroon short jacket that buttons to the proper right of the garment. It has a fur lining in the inner side of the jacket.

metadata.subject_terms_2: Jackets Ethnic costume Silk  Men's clothing  Fur
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This short jacket is known as a ‘magua’ ?? and was worn over a long robe (‘changshan’ or ‘changpao’) in the early 20th century in China and Hong Kong. This fur-lined jacket would have been used during the winter season. 

It belonged to Mr Kaan Tat Choi, who was a successful businessman in the bullion business. Mr Kaan expanded his business from Hong Kong to Malaya in the 1920s, acquiring several rubber plantations along the east coast of Malaya. He also opened a bullion trading company called “Yee Shing” at 20 Canal Road in Singapore in the 1930s
